result.execSummary:
The defendant Aimee M Paffel was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take (<=$500), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Must report to probation by end of business on 10/09/2014.

miscConds.notes:
Attorney fees to be determined.
If probation or extended supervision is allowed to expire or is revoked with outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall notify the court 10 days prior to the revocation or discharge and provide current financial information.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for any balances due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.
Must have no contact with Kohls Store in Rice Lake, Wisconsin.

Must complete any and all evaluations, counseling, treatment and follow-up recommended by Probation Agent.
Must participate in a restorative justice program/conference that may include the victim(s).

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Aimee M Paffel

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Aimee M Paffel in court with attorney Andrew Joseph Harrington.  Russell E. Berg appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Court Amends the charge to misdemeanor retail theft;   943.50(1m)(b)   Joint recommendation.  Guilty plea The Court finds plea is knowingly, intelligently and voluntarily given and finds the defendant guilty.  Factual basis found. 

Argument by Attorney Harrington 

Court orders a with held sentence
Probation  12 months.     Must report by end of business on 10-09-2014 
Must complete any and all evaluations, counseling, treatment and follow-up recommended by Probation Agent.
No contact with the Kohls store in Rice Lake WI
Participate in the Barron County Rstorative Justice 
50 hours of community service.
Restitution set at 0
Court Costs
Attorney Fees - $100.00 per month by wage assignment beginning 10-01-2014- Andrew Harrington
Information - Received phone call from employer with correct information to send wage assignment
Attorney Fees - $100.00 per month by wage assignment beginning 10/01/2014 - Andrew Harrington

Defendant Aimee M Paffel in court with attorney Andrew Joseph Harrington.  Russell E. Berg appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Preliminary Hearing Waived;  The Court finds waiver is knowingly, intelligently and voluntarily given.
  Probable Cause Found and Bound Over
  Information Filed.  Defense waives reading
  Plea of Not Guilty
  Plea hearing scheduled for October 8, 2014 at 02:00 pm.
